feed.title: Azure Architecture Center

entry.title: Mainframe file and tape backup to Azure using Luminex

entry.summary: Learn about non-relational databases that store data as key/value pairs, graphs, time series, objects, and other storage models, based on data requirements.

entry.title: Real-time processing
entry.summary: Use real-time processing solutions to capture data streams and generate reports or automated responses with minimal latency.

entry.title: Online transaction processing (OLTP)
entry.summary: Learn about atomicity, consistency, and other features of online transaction processing (OLTP), which manages transactional data while supporting querying.

entry.title: Processing CSV and JSON files
entry.summary: Learn about CSV and JSON files, the most common formats for ingesting, exchanging, and storing unstructured or semi-structured data.

entry.title: Data lakes
entry.summary: Learn about data lake storage repositories, which can hold terabytes and petabytes of data in native, raw format.

entry.title: Choose a data storage technology
entry.summary: Compare big data storage technology options in Azure, including key selection criteria and a capability matrix.

entry.title: Choose a data pipeline orchestration technology
entry.summary: Choose an Azure data pipeline orchestration technology to automate pipeline orchestration, control flow, and data movement workflows.

entry.title: Choose a real-time message ingestion technology
entry.summary: Choose an Azure message ingestion store to support message buffering, scale-out processing, reliable delivery, and queuing semantics.

entry.title: Choose a search data store
entry.summary: Learn about the capabilities of search data stores in Azure and the key criteria for choosing one that best matches your needs.

entry.title: Criteria for data store choice
entry.summary: Explore general considerations when choosing your data store. Examine functional and non-functional requirements, management and cost, security, and DevOps.

entry.title: Data store decision tree
entry.summary: Select an Azure data store for your application. View a graphical representation of choosing your data store.

entry.title: Understand data store models
entry.summary: Learn about the high-level differences between the various data storage models found in Azure data services.

entry.title: Improved-security access to multitenant web apps from an on-premises network
entry.summary: Set up improved-security private connectivity to a multitenant web app or function app from an on-premises network or from within an Azure virtual network.

entry.title: Hub-spoke network topology in Azure
entry.summary: Learn about hub-spoke topology in Azure, where the spoke virtual networks connect to the hub virtual network and can connect to each other.

entry.title: Unified logging for microservices apps
entry.summary: Learn about logging, tracing, and monitoring for microservices apps and learn how to run synthetic logging for testing and create structured logs for analysis.

entry.title: Serverless Functions reference architectures
entry.summary: Learn about serverless reference architectures.

entry.title: Extract, transform, and load (ETL)
entry.summary: Learn about extract-transform-load (ETL) and extract-load-transform (ELT) data transformation pipelines, and how to use control flows and data flows.

entry.title: Online analytical processing (OLAP)
entry.summary: Learn about online analytical processing (OLAP) solutions to organize large databases and support complex analysis without affecting transactional systems.

entry.summary: Compare technology choices for big data batch processing in Azure, including key selection criteria and a capability matrix.

entry.summary: Compare options for real-time message stream processing in Azure, with key selection criteria and a capability matrix.

entry.title: Forecast energy and power demand
entry.summary: Forecast spikes in demand for energy products and services with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning and give your company a competitive advantage.

entry.title: Stream processing with fully managed open-source data engines
entry.summary: Stream events by using fully managed Azure data services. Use open-source technologies like Kafka, Kubernetes, Cassandra, PostgreSQL, and Redis components.

entry.title: Application integration using Azure Event Grid
entry.summary: Learn how to integrate your app with Azure Event Grid and take advantage of its reliable delivery, advanced routing, and direct integration.

entry.title: Azure Data Explorer interactive analytics
entry.summary: Use interactive analytics in Azure Data Explorer. Examine structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data with improvised, interactive, and fast queries.

entry.title: Azure Data Explorer monitoring
entry.summary: Use Azure Data Explorer in a hybrid monitoring solution that includes Microsoft Sentinel and Azure Monitor to ingest streamed and batched logs from diverse sources.

entry.summary: Deploy SWIFT Alliance Lite2 on Azure. Migrate an existing deployment from on-premises or create a new deployment.

entry.summary: Run SWIFT Alliance Messaging Hub (AMH) on Azure. This messaging solution helps financial institutions to securely and efficiently bring new services to market.

entry.title: Design review powered by mixed reality
entry.summary: With this mixed reality scenario, clients, designers, and onsite engineers can easily share and review designs as 3D holograms in the context of their environment.

entry.summary: Help employees learn processes and materials effectively by providing persistent holographic instructions mapped to precise locations in physical workspaces.

entry.summary: Learn how to send application logs and metrics from Azure Databricks to a Log Analytics workspace using the Azure Databricks Monitoring Library.

entry.summary: Learn how to set up a Grafana dashboard to monitor performance of Azure Databricks jobs. Azure Databricks is an Apache Spark-based analytics service.

entry.summary: Automate data flows with Apache NiFi on Azure. Use a scalable, highly available solution to move data into the cloud or storage and between cloud systems.

entry.summary: Integrate Profisee master data management with Microsoft Purview, to build a foundation for data governance and management. Produce and deliver high-quality, trusted data.

entry.title: Azure Cosmos DB considerations for multitenancy
entry.summary: This article describes the features of Azure Cosmos DB that are useful when working with multitenanted systems, and links to guidance and examples for how to use Azure Cosmos DB in a multitenant solution.
